intro: Centaurea euphratica, commonly known as the Euphrates centaury, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of the Middle East and Central Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of ray and disk florets. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with erect, branching stems and gray-green, hairy leaves. Its flowers are bright yellow with a distinctive purple or reddish central disk, and it produces small, elongated achenes as its fruit. Centaurea euphratica is adapted to drought conditions and often thrives in sandy or rocky soils.
